meta.name: description
meta.content: Main Page for North Huron School
Main Page for North Huron School
Main Page for North Huron School

p.font: To all North Huron residents, the deadline to respond to the 2020 Census is fast approaching. If you have not responded by this point please do so now. Responding to your 2020 Census invitation helps shape your future and your community’s future. In addition to determining legislative representation, the information is used to allocate federal funding for hospitals, schools, public infrastructure projects, just to name of few of the uses, based on population.

Most households received their invitation to respond to the 2020 Census between March 12-20. These official Census Bureau mailings included detailed information and a Census ID for completing the census online. You can complete your form online, by phone, or by mail. Visit my2020census.gov to begin.

p.span: North Huron School is asking that parents/guardians complete a short survey to help district staff determine how many families would be able to access learning materials for their children via the internet during this unprecedented time which will require remote learning for students.

span.font: Please complete the survey at the link below by Tuesday, April 7.

i.font: North Huron School has gathered sites and resources to help our students continue learning while at home.

font.a: Please click HERE to use this as a resource to find reviewed and easy to access resources.

font.span: Comcast and Spectrum are offering free internet for 60 day

p.span: h new accounts - Check their sites for availability in your area

span.font: COVID-19 School Closure Update of April 17

p.font: North Huron School Families – By this point in time all families should have received a conference “Check-In” phone contact from a school representative. Thank you for answering those calls and for updating the staff on how your family is doing during this time. We are using the information shared by families to determine what each household needs to support remote learning. The most common identified needs included school supplies, devices, internet access and printed packets. We are working to secure materials and provide them to families to the extent possible. Our teachers will be providing supplemental foundational learning lessons and activities for students and families to work on beginning Monday, April 20. If you asked for paper packets to be provided for your student they will be delivered by TAT over the course of the next week. You should expect that you will continue to receive a weekly progress check-in call from a school representative. Please share any information that you feel will be of value to teachers as they work to plan the remote learning for students. Getting honest feedback will help them to know what is working and what might need to be modified. We cannot stress enough how important it is that remote learning will only truly benefit students if our partnership with parents is genuine. Quick reminders – the food need survey will remain active on the website and Facebook page for anyone to complete and request food as needed. Complete your census response by going to the website “my2020census.gov”. Also, we are planning to return student personal property at either the end of next week (April 24) or the start of the following week (April 27 or 28). All items will be packaged and sent home on TAT, this includes family owned band instruments.

b.span: Ongoing Food Need Request Survey for Families

span.font: Due to the extended school closure and the number of businesses that are either reducing workers’ hours or laying employees off, North Huron is continuing to offer meal kits to families who have a need for food for children aged 18 and under. Whenever you decide that your family needs to use this service, please complete the survey at the link below so that we can gather the needed information in order to provide meals for your children. The information will only be seen by a limited number of NHS staff who are helping with this process. Know that we respect your privacy and the information will be treated confidentially. To help us plan so that we best meet the need of our communities, this survey should be completed by noon on Monday in any given week in order to receive food on Wednesday of the next week. Questions regarding this survey can be directed by text message to 989.553.4124. Please click on the link below to complete this survey.

b.font: Click on the link for thoughts and ideas to "Be Nice"

font.a: COVID-19 The North Huron School will follow the guidelines and protocols established under the direction of Governor Whitmer regarding COVID-19. Click this message to read the Governor's official March 11, 2020 release.
